title: Vice President of Guest Experience Technology
description:
Our mission is to create the Experience of a Lifetime for our employees, so they can, in turn, create the Experience of a Lifetime for our guests. We own and operate the most renowned destination resorts in the world as well as regional and local ski areas outside major cities, and connect them all through one unrivaled network. Candidates for year-round positions are reviewed on a rolling basis. Applications will be accepted up to 90 days after the posting date, or until the position is filled (whichever is first).

 **Job Summary:**


The Vice President of Guest Experience Technology is responsible for leading and managing ~60 members of the IT Teams responsible for Digital Technology, Enterprise Data Engineering, and Marketing and Guest Experience Applications. They will partner with our Omni-Channel, Digital Marketing, and Marketing Analytics teams to create a digital ecosystem that delivers the Vail Resorts brand experiences, drives engagement, and contributes to the financial targets for our mountain resorts.Marketing applications and Digital Technology include transforming and overseeing the Vail Resorts Digital Technology function through the evolution of our digital guest experience, including eCommerce platforms, A/B testing, site-tracking capabilities, user experience, My Epic App, and much more. Enterprise Data Engineering includes transforming and overseeing the Vail Resorts Marketing Technology Business Intelligence and Data Enablement function through the evolution of our enterprise data journey.

  

This role will be responsible for developing, socializing and leading multi-year application modernization efforts to ensure stability and scalability while adding incremental business value aligned with our business objectives. Candidates must bring deep experience with leadership over custom software engineering and enterprise-level production support and compliance. The ideal candidate will be one who can influence diverse stakeholders throughout the business and at the executive level while also being a strong and influential leader who can lead a team of senior leaders that oversee project managers, business analysts, developers, and consultants.

 **Job Specifications:**

* Outlet: Corporate
* The budgeted range starts at $230,000 - $260,000 + annual bonus + equity. Actual pay will be adjusted based on experience
* Shift & Schedule Availability: Full Time, Year Round
* Other Specifics: Hybrid - Remote

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* **Business Strategy, Innovation, Stakeholder Management**
	+ Develop an understanding of our business and collaborate closely with our various stakeholders to identify and influence opportunities to drive business value through technology innovation with a focus on the evolution and modernization of our Application Ecosystem
	+ Bring new ideas, methods, and approaches to business partner ideation, business process re-imagination and technology innovation
	+ Inspire trust and build strong relationships across locations, functions, business units, and levels across the enterprise
* **Technology Strategy, Alignment, Governance**
	+ Drive the development of a multi-year functional and technical product roadmap for the modernization of our applications
	+ Ensure the product roadmap is aligned with our business objectives, stakeholder expectations, and the enterprise architecture across the rest of the application ecosystem
	+ Facilitate prioritization and governance discussions in a dynamic and fluid business environment to ensure our resources are appropriately allocated to the top priorities of the company
* **Financial Management**
	+ Develop, socialize, and execute IT capital plans, enhancements, and modernization with a focus on delivering business value with defined ROI’s with each capital investments
	+ Collaborate with business partners on application related Capital Projects to provide accurate Capital Assessments, Business Cases and ROI’s
	+ Develop annual operating budgets and provide accurate monthly forecasting throughout the Fiscal Year
	+ Effectively manage all Capital and Expense budgets and forecasts
* **Risk and Compliance**
	+ Work closely with our External Auditors, Internal Audit department, and IT Risk and Compliance team to proactively anticipate and address business and IT risks and internal and external compliance requirements associated with the application
	+ Ensure all SOX and PCI compliance responsibilities are met and verified through our annual audit processes
	+ Provide support, analysis, and recommendations for any internal audits related to the application
* **Leadership, Employee Engagement**
	+ Demonstrate a passion for our culture, mission, values, vision, products and services.
	+ Lead by example and inspire others to follow
	+ Develop clear and measurable action plans and show continuous improvement in employee engagement as measured in our annual employee engagement surveys
* **Performance Management, Employee Development, Process Improvement**
	+ Set clear business and performance goals and provide timely and relevant feedback for the team to drive a culture of personal development and team accountability for consistent, high-quality results
	+ Drive continuous improvement and capability maturity throughout the entire software development life cycle and the various team disciplines that include project management, business analysis, user interface design and development, application architecture, application design and development, integration, quality assurance, and solution delivery
	+ Ensure all team members are supported by their leaders in the creation and pursuit of Career Plans and Individual Development Plans
	+ Cultivate talent and develop an environment that will attract and retain the best, and serve as a mentor to those in and outside of the Team
* **External Networking, Vendor Management**
	+ Develop a strong external network of industry leaders, peers, consulting partners and third-party software and services providers
	+ Identify, select, and manage consultants and staff augmentation partners leveraged to add required skills and capacity to support the Roadmap and Project Portfolio
	+ Negotiate contracts, master services agreements, statements of work, licensing and support agreements and the procure-to-pay process for engagements with external vendors

 **Job Requirements:**

* 15+ years of progressive experience in commercial and custom software application development and product management
* 10+ years’ experience managing eCommerce, website development and/or digital customer experience innovation
* 8+ years of experience managing a complex portfolio of projects across a diverse set of stakeholders
* 8+ years of experience managing an application with SOX, PCI, and Information Protection responsibilities
* 6+ years of experience presenting and influencing strategic and tactical plans to executive level stakeholders in IT and in the business
* 6+ years managing teams of project managers, business analysts and developers
* 6+ years managing enterprise level software development projects with vendor partners
* Demonstrated ability to design, develop, and execute an enterprise level, multi-year modernization of a critical application
* Ability to analyze online trends, data, and leverage site statistics and performance to influence strategy and roadmap
* Well-versed in cloud-based data platforms and managed services, data visualization and machine learning capabilities.
* Well-versed in Software Development Life-Cycle methodologies
* Microsoft Application Development, Integration, and Reporting and Analytics Technology Stack
* Consistent track record of leadership and business innovation through technology solutions.
* Comfortable working across a large, matrixed organization and capable of driving technology alignment with a business strategy.
* Demonstrated leadership in building high-performing teams and leading change.
* Strong business and financial acumen, including direct Capital and Expense budget oversight
* Bachelor's Degree in Technology or related field required

 **Preferred Skills:**

* Experience in application user interface design and user experience
* Experience designing and developing point of sale applications
* Experience in Travel, Hospitality and/or Resort industries

  

The expected Total Compensation for this role is $230,000 - $260,000 + annual bonus + equity. Individual compensation decisions are based on a variety of factors.

 **Job Benefits**

* Ski/Mountain Perks! Free passes for employees, employee discounted lift tickets for friends and family AND free ski lessons
* MORE employee discounts on lodging, food, gear, and mountain shuttles
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Employee Assistance Program

* Free ski passes for dependents
* Critical Illness and Accident plans

title: Scarsdale Farmers Market Manager
description:
APPLY NOW  

Posted 9/9/24  




Part-time, $20/hour position available at our brand new farmers market in Scarsdale. Work hours are weekly on Sundays from 7am-3pm at the market, located at the intersection of Spencer Road and Chase Place, and a few additional hours at home to file reports and occasionally in the field to help with promotion (generally a total of 8-10 hours weekly).


This is an ideal position for someone with retail, management, customer service, teaching, or other leadership experience, who is interested in learning about and contributing to the local food system. You should be friendly and happy to talk to all kinds of people, willing to do some physical work, able to communicate clearly and with confidence to both your Down to Earth colleagues and the vendors and customers in the market, organized and aware of the importance of good record keeping and reporting.


The Farmers Market Manager oversees day-of-market operations as Down to Earth Markets' on-site representative, working closely with the company's office team to help ensure the market's success and spearhead interactions with market vendors, shoppers and the community:


* Supervising and managing daily operations to assure a smooth- and safe-running market
* Enforcing market rules and regulations
* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers
* Assisting shoppers and vendors with use of food access and nutrition programs (SNAP, FMNP)
* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions
* Attending weekly conference calls with fellow managers and the Operations Manager

Occasionally filling in for fellow site managers at other market locations  
* 

Physical / schedule requirements:


* Commit to consistently working 8-10 hours a week
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
* Able to walk and stand for several hours at a time
* Able to work in all weather conditions, e.g. heat, cold, rain, sun, wind, snow
* Lead market set up and breakdown, including directing people and vehicles, moving equipment, and cleaning up the market site as needed
* Complete two days of shadowing alongside another site manager at another farmers market as part of training
* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
* Communicate regularly, effectively, and in detail, including filing timely reports, to ensure a steady flow of information between the market and the office
* Monitor and reply to messages from the office, especially around end-of market reporting and pre-market prep
* Have use of a smartphone to use Microsoft Teams, our reporting web app, and Facebook/Instagram/Meta Business Suite during the market day

We are seeking candidates who are available to start immediately. Training will be provided.
